How to Use PrismWeave

1

Install Your Tool

Choose either the browser extension for full integration or drag the bookmarklet to your bookmarks bar for quick access.

2

Configure GitHub

Set up your GitHub personal access token and repository details in the settings. This is where your captured content will be saved.

3

Capture Content

Navigate to any webpage and click the extension icon or bookmarklet to extract clean markdown content automatically.

4

Review & Save

Preview the extracted content, make any adjustments, and save it directly to your GitHub repository as organized markdown files.

üìã Installation Instructions

üß© Browser Extension Setup

Step-by-step guide to install the PrismWeave browser extension:

1

Download

Download the latest release from GitHub and extract the ZIP file to a folder on your computer.

2

Enable Developer Mode

Go to chrome://extensions/ and toggle "Developer mode" on in the top-right corner.

3

Load Extension

Click "Load unpacked" and select the extracted extension folder. The PrismWeave icon will appear in your toolbar.

üîñ Bookmarklet Setup

Recommended: Use the Personal Bookmarklet Generator for the best experience:

1

Generate Personal Bookmarklet

Visit the Personal Bookmarklet Generator and enter your GitHub token and repository details.

2

Drag & Drop

Drag the generated custom bookmarklet to your bookmarks bar. Your settings are embedded - no configuration needed!

3

Capture Content

Navigate to any webpage and click your custom bookmark. Content will be automatically captured and saved to your GitHub repository.

üìù Alternative: Basic Setup

You can also use the demo bookmarklet above, but you'll need to configure your GitHub settings each time you use it on a new domain.
